item.title: prema add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Never trust a man who reads only one book." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: prema add a quote by Jean Baudrillard
item.description: "We live in a world where there is more and more information, and less and less meaning." -- Jean Baudrillard

item.title: prema add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: prema add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I wish I had more friends, but people are such jerks. If you can just get most people to leave you alone, you're doing good. If you can find even one person you really like, you're lucky. And if that person can also stand you, you're really lucky." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: prema add a quote by Mary Roach
item.description: "The way I see it, being dead is not terribly far off from being on a cruise ship. Most of your time is spent lying on your back. The brain has shut down. The flesh begins to soften. Nothing much new happens, and nothing is expected of you. " -- Mary Roach

item.title: prema add a quote by Mary Roach
item.description: "Life contains these things: leakage and wickage and discharge, pus and snot and slime and gleet. We are biology. We are reminded of this at the beginning and the end, at birth and at death. In between we do what we can to forget." -- Mary Roach
